subject: Problems going from JUnit 3.2 to 3.4
msgSnippet: I am running JDK 1.3 on Windows 98. I have been running JUnit 3.2 very successfully for some time now. Thought it might be time to upgrade. However, in a
messageBody:
I am running JDK 1.3 on Windows 98. I have been running JUnit 3.2
very successfully for some time now. Thought it might be time to
upgrade. However, in a project I am currently working on, I've found
that tests that run just fine under 3.2 (non-loading runner) will not
run under 3.4. Furthermore, when I use the LoadingTestRunner under
3.2 I seem to be getting the same (or similar) problem. Namely, I get
a "Could not invoke suite() method" error.

The only thing I can think of is that since the TestRunners have been
re-factored under 3.4 and the separation between loading and non-
loading is gone, that perhaps there is something in the class loader
that is causing this.

Has anyone experienced similar troubles?

Thanks.

Chris
